data.title: Oracle NetSuite Company Profile, News & Solutions
data.meta_description: Read the latest news & information about Oracle NetSuite by expert analysts. Get information about new software solutions & products by Oracle NetSuite.
data.text:
Oracle NetSuite stands out as a major player in the realm of enterprise resource planning (ERP) and other software, having established its foundation in 1998. The vendor is currently headquartered in Austin, Texas, and its software portfolio has been leveraged by businesses located across the globe, with the vendor holding satellite offices in Europe, the Americas, and Asia-Pacific.

The company’s solutions, most notably its flagship ERP product, serve an array of industries including retail, manufacturing, wholesale distribution, healthcare, non-profit, hospitality, and more. Oracle NetSuite’s software also caters to the varied needs of small-to-medium-sized businesses (SMBs) and especially larger enterprises, with a notable presence in the mid-market segment. Those usually tasked with using Oracle NetSuite’s software range from positions like financial analysts to project managers and operations managers, among other roles.

The company’s software suite encompasses a range of solutions such as ERP and customer relationship management (CRM). These solutions are deployed primarily via cloud-based models, ensuring accessibility from anywhere, flexibility, and scalability that growing businesses often require. Clients benefit from the vendor’s extensive customer support, with Oracle NetSuite providing product configuration assistance and solution guidance, a support community for insights from fellow users, and a SuiteAnswers knowledge center with support articles, training videos, and best practices.

Oracle NetSuite’s integration capabilities are expansive, facilitating connectivity with a multitude of tools and systems. Namely, the vendor’s ERP product can integrate with productivity tools and payment processors, while its open application programming interface (API) support allows users to build custom integrations and add-ons.

The company’s software solutions are known for their robustness, and their cloud-based deployment has made them a compelling option for companies aiming to expand. To that end, Oracle NetSuite also offers multi-currency, -country, and -company support. The vendor’s efforts have not gone unnoticed, with numerous awards and accolades gracing its portfolio. Additionally, Oracle NetSuite issues its own Partner of the Year awards to a selection of its various partners.

“At Oracle NetSuite's SuiteWorld 2023 conference, NetSuite celebrated 25 years in the enterprise software market and showcased their increasing revenues and global customer expansion. The 'SuiteUP' theme underlined numerous enhancements for improved productivity and profitability, including the introduction of NetSuite Enterprise Performance Management (EPM), enhanced reporting, innovative tax solutions, and new services like NetSuite Bill Capture and NetSuite Capital. A flexible licensing model was also unveiled, starting with NetSuite WMS.”

PJ Jakovljevic, Principal TEC Analyst. Learn more about the advancements of Oracle NetSuite in this article that highlights the vendor’s 2023 accomplishments and advancements.

Software Offered by Oracle NetSuite

Oracle NetSuite’s product suite is extensive, addressing a variety of business needs. The vendor’s cloud ERP solution, standing as the flagship product, offers robust financial management capabilities like planning and budgeting, supply chain management (SCM), and inventory management functionalities. Beginning with the popular cloud ERP system, some of Oracle NetSuite’s noteworthy software products are as follows:

NetSuite ERP: Oracle NetSuite’s flagship product, renowned for its comprehensive capabilities in automating and bolstering key business processes. From accounting, financial management, and inventory management to order management and procurement, NetSuite ERP covers an extensive range of functionalities. It enables businesses to have real-time visibility into their operations, aiding in more informed and agile decision-making, in addition to supporting multiple currencies and companies.

NetSuite CRM: This software solution incorporates sales force automation, marketing automation, and customer service management, ensuring a 360-degree view of the customer. Sales teams and marketing professionals find this tool invaluable for tracking leads, managing opportunities, and creating personalized customer experiences, all of which contributes to enhanced consumer retention, loyalty, and lifetime value.

NetSuite OpenAir: This cloud-based professional services automation (PSA) solution is designed to support services companies in project management, resource management, and project accounting. It ensures that projects are delivered on time and within budget, proving invaluable for project managers.

NetSuite OneWorld: Tailored for businesses operating on a global scale, NetSuite OneWorld ERP addresses the complexities of multinational operations. It supports multiple currencies, taxation rules, and compliance requirements, making it a vital tool for financial analysts and compliance officers in international businesses.

NetSuite Inventory Management: Another cloud-based solution designed to serve medium-to-large enterprises. The system facilitates demand and supply planning and warehouse, bin, and supplier management for enhanced productivity and customer services and streamlined order management.

In addition to these above-mentioned solutions, Oracle NetSuite offers software for omnichannel commerce, human capital management (HCM), procurement, warehouse management (WMS), and more, making it a substantial software provider with a varied, extensive portfolio.

Oracle NetSuite Company Metrics

Oracle NetSuite, with its impressive global footprint, has grown to a significant size since its inception. Oracle NetSuite reportedly boasts 15,000 staff members and around $3.2B in revenue. In the year 2023, NetSuite achieved a 21% increase in revenue and served more than 37,000 corporate customers spanning 219 countries and dependent territories.

Companies Owned by Oracle NetSuite

NetSuite, originally founded as NetLedger, was acquired by Oracle in 2016, but has made several notable purchases of its own since its foundation, including:

Bronto Software: a company specializing in cloud-based commerce marketing, which NetSuite acquired in 2015.

Venda: a London-based provider of e-commerce solutions acquired in 2014.

Retail Anywhere: acquired in 2013 for its multi-channel retail management solutions.

Top Competitors of Oracle NetSuite

As a leading player in the enterprise software space, Oracle NetSuite competes with some of the industry’s biggest companies, including:

SAP: a world-renowned software provider with flexible deployment options, a flagship ERP solution, and its own CRM, HR, and business intelligence (BI) systems.

Microsoft: a major vendor in today’s software space, providing varied deployment options and solutions in an array of categories, including ERP, CRM, project accounting, and BI.

Infor: an established vendor with various cloud-based ERP solutions designed to serve specific industries, including construction and distribution.

Sage: a leading vendor founded in the UK and providing ERP, accounting and invoicing solutions, and more.
